result.execSummary:
The defendant Sonya M Daniels was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Contributing to Truancy, a class C misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.45(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: To be paid 60 days after release from jail. Failure to pay will be a warrant.
To be paid 60 days after release from jail. Failure to pay will be a warrant.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Sonya M Daniels in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:13 PM. Called 16CF124, 16CF126 and 16CM63. State - resolved - Court has received a signed settlement recommendation as to what was promised the defendant regarding the plea agreement - 16CF124  amend #1 to county ordinance of DC with $1000 forfeiture plus costs, on counts #2 and #3 - plead G as alleged, joint recommendation of 2 years probation, consecutive to any sentence she is currently serving (Shawano County Case #15CF140), on count #2 - impose and stay 9 months in FC jail, on count #3 - impose and stay 9 months in FC jail - consecutive to count #2, $300 fine plus costs and surcharges on both counts #2 and #3, counts #4 and #5 - DRI, probation conditions are: AODA and follow thru, absolute sobriety, no possession or entry in any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, obtain HS diploma or equivalent, 150 hours of community service, attend and successfully complete a parenting program, attend a weekly self help group with weekly reporting, 16CF126 - plead G to count #1 as alleged, joint recommendation of 45 days jail - concurrent to any sentence she is currently serving, counts #2, #4 and #5 - DRI, #3 - amend to county ordinance of bail jumping with a $1000 forfeiture plus costs; on 16CM63 - plead G as alleged, $300 fine plus costs. Lynch and Daniels agree, does point out the error on the plea questionnaire (checked NC instead of G plea) and she has obtained a HSED already. Court also goes over the paragraph in the plea agreement regading cooperating in other criminal matters charged in FC. Daniels understands. Court - 16CF126 - dismiss and reads in counts, #2, #4 and #5, 16CF124 - dismiss and read in counts #4 and #5, 16CF124 - amend count #1 to county ordinance of DC, pleads G, finds G, fine of $1000.00 plus costs - 60 DTP after release from custody/CO; 16CF126 - amend count #3 to county ordinance of bail jumping, pleads G, finds G, fine of $1000.00 plus costs - 60 DTP after release from custody/CO. Daniels pleads G to all other counts as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her plea and right to JT, accepts pleas, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Lynch makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - asks that the 45 day jail run concurrent to Shawano County Case. Daniels makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 16CM63 - $300.00 fine plus costs and surcharges - 60 DTP after release from custody/CO, submit DNA sample; 16CF124 - counts #2 and #3 - impose and stay 9 months in the FC jail - consecutive to each and consecutive to jail time on 16CF126 and to Shawano County Case #15CF140 - huber and good time available - eligible for community service under 93.03(3), place on probation for 2 years on each count - concurrent to each other but consecutive to current sentence on Shawano County Case #15CF140, with conditions of probation as follows: AODA and follow thru, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry in any bars or taverns, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 150 hours of community service to be served within the first 1 year of probation, attend and successfully complete a parenting program, attend at least one AA/NA or similar meeting each week and proof of attendance to P&P, $300.00 fine plus costs and surcharges on each count - paid 60 days after release from incarceration/CO, submit DNA sample; 16CF126 - count #1 - 45 days in Forest County Jail - concurrent to jail time on Shawano County Case #15CF140 - report today - will be serving the jail time in Shawano County but it is the ultimate decision of the Sheriff (s) - huber and good time allowed - eligible for community sevice under 973.03(3) - credit can be determined thru stipulation, costs - to be paid 60 days after release from custody/CO, submit DNA sample, right to appeal, the defendant will be done with her Shawano County jail term at the end of April - 2017, adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 25, 2017 at 01:15 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 5, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on January 5, 2017 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Chad Lynch in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:53 PM. State - believes the defendant is currently in treatment. Court continues bond, sets for JT.  Jury trial scheduled for January 5, 2017 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on November 2, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
No consumption of alcohol. Children must attend school as required.

Defendant Sonya M Daniels in court with attorney Chad Lynch.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 9:53 AM. Lynch has went over complaint with Daniels, waives further reading and enters NG pleas. State asks for bond conditions: children to attend school as required and no consumption of alcohol. Court sets $500 signature bond, no consumption of alcohol and children must attend school as required.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 2, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Sonya M Daniels
Current: 5616 Wemojgoek, Crandon, WI 54520 United States  (Effective: 10-12-2016)
Prior: N6920 Cornelius Circle, Oneida, WI 54155 United States

Attorney Chad Lynch in court.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 10:33 AM. Lynch was not aware of this case, does represent her on other matters that are scheduled for 10/19/16 at 10:15 AM. Lynch asks for the matter to be rescheduled and no warrant issued. Court reviews file, sees address is not the same as the one she gave us last week, State to re-summons to new address.
